alert.note: Alert for City of Hyder (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 23 at 11:38PM AKST until December 25 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR PARTS OF SE AK THROUGH CHRISTMAS... Multiple frontal bands will pass over the panhandle through the weekend bringing periods of snow. A band of snow is moving through the north this evening. Reports of light to moderate snow have been coming in so far. A range of snowfall reports from the northern panhandle have been from 1 to 14 inches. Reports from the southern panhandle have been from 3 to 8 inches of snow with more expected before becoming a wintry mix, or all rain, by morning. A break, or at least a decrease in snowfall rates is occurring overnight across south, and the break remains on track for the morning hours over the north as a second frontal band tracks into the southern panhandle early Saturday. This front will move north into the northern areas by Saturday afternoon. This front will bring another round of snow and a chance of freezing rain for the central inner channels with the south changing to all rain through Saturday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Storm total snow accumulations of 20 to 25 inches. * WHERE...City of Hyder. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Greatest snowfall rates expected through Friday evening and again Saturday mid morning. A period of light freezing rain is possible late Saturday night into early Sunday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
